concepts.title: Properties of Air
concepts.content: Air is a mixture of several gases. It has mass and weight. Air exerts pressure in all directions, known as atmospheric pressure. At sea level, it is about 1,01,300 Newtons per square meter.

examples.text: Drinking through a straw uses air pressure
Bicycle tires filled with compressed air

keyPoints: Air pressure decreases as we go higher from sea level
Bernoulli's Principle: High velocity air has low pressure
Humidity is the amount of water vapor in the air
concepts.funFact: Daniel Bernoulli, a Swedish scientist, discovered in 1738 that air pressure decreases when its velocity increases!
